meanings.definition: The ability to use military aircraft in combat.
meanings.sent1: The country's airpowers were crucial in winning the war.
meanings.sent2: The airpowers of the military were unmatched by any other nation.
meanings.sent3: The airpowers of the enemy were no match for our clever tactics.
meanings.sent4: The airpowers of the fighter jets soared above the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The airpowers of the bombers struck fear into the hearts of the enemy.

meanings.definition: The strength or force exerted by military aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The airpowers of the jets could be felt rumbling through the sky.
meanings.sent2: The airpowers of the helicopters were evident in their swift movements.
meanings.sent3: The airpowers of the planes made the ground shake with their thunderous roar.
meanings.sent4: The airpowers of the bombers unleashed destruction upon the target.
meanings.sent5: The airpowers of the aircraft were a formidable display of might.

meanings.definition: The capability or effectiveness of military aircraft in warfare.
meanings.sent1: The airpowers of the fleet were instrumental in securing victory.
meanings.sent2: The airpowers of the squadron were unmatched in precision strikes.
meanings.sent3: The airpowers of the air force turned the tide of battle in our favor.
meanings.sent4: The airpowers of the military planes dominated the skies.
meanings.sent5: The airpowers of the fighter jets were a sight to behold in the sky.
